cyclone.name: JERRY
cyclone.trajectory: Turning north on Monday and northeast on Tuesday, passing near Bermuda while moving away from the northeastern Caribbean
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or just west of Bermuda

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Leeward Islands and Puerto Rico experiencing large swells and rip currents, but core of Jerry remains well north of the islands
weather_observation.wind: Occasional rain squalls with gusts 20â€“25 kt possible as outer bands brush the area
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected; only minor water level fluctuations from distant swell
weather_observation.rainfall: Scattered showers; widespread 4-inch totals not expected
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents on Atlantic-facing beaches through Monday
